traits.label: target
traits.name: :target
traits.desc: Configure a target element to trigger component toggle; 'true' means it enables the parent DOM element, 'false' means it disables attaching events to any DOM elements; By using a String (CSS selector) or a DOM element it attaches the events to the specified DOM element (if it exists)

traits.label: no-parent-event
traits.name: :no-parent-event
traits.desc: Skips attaching events to the target DOM element (that trigger the element to get shown)

traits.label: context-menu
traits.name: :context-menu
traits.desc: Allows the component to behave like a context menu, which opens with a right mouse click (or long tap on mobile)

traits.label: model-value
traits.name: :model-value
traits.desc: Defines the state of the component (shown/hidden); Either use this property (along with a listener for 'update:modelValue' event) OR use v-model directive

traits.label: breakpoint
traits.name: :breakpoint
traits.desc: Breakpoint (in pixels) of window width/height (whichever is smaller) from where a Menu will get to be used instead of a Dialog
